p: It is, therefore, clear that losses from climate change are not occurring to the ecosystem and people separately, but to an interconnected system with embedded social, cultural and ecological structures that form the foundation of identity, wellbeing, way of life, worldviews and self-esteem (Couzin 2007; Mustonen 2013; Williams and Hardison 2014; Movono et al. 2017; Yazzie et al. 2019). In this way, one stakeholder emphasised that climate change is “another mode of erasure” of Indigenous people altogether (participant #1, 2020).
